page.title: 05THE NORTHERN OUTFALL SEWER
page.content: The Northern Outfall Sewer runs through Newham. It takes the dirty water from London to Beckton. It is cleaned and then flows into the River Thames. In the old days there was no sewer. People used to get a disease from the dirty water. There are no houses on the bank because under a house you need a foundation to support it and under the bank there is only dirty water. The sewer bank is long and narow and has a footpath along it. There are lots of different kinds of grasses and wild flowers. Two of the grasses are meadow foxtail and false oat grass. We found a birds nest and lots of insects. There are big muddy puddles and some rubbish.
